key_contexts: High-value defence procurement with mandated offsets
Weak transparency and oversight in offset contracting
Cross-border arms trade involving multiple suppliers and governments
key_mechanisms: Offsets increase contractual complexity, creating opaque side agreements
Discretion in offset fulfilment enables rent-seeking and influence-peddling
Lack of standardisation undermines monitoring and accountability
key_outcomes: Increased corruption risk in defence procurement
Potential erosion of trust between partner governments
noted_risks_or_mitigations: Corruption and reputational risk for allied programmes
Mitigation via transparency requirements and independent audit
